message: We are literally heading into the dark ages
story: Mosab Ibrahim shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Heading to the Dark Ages! | Mosab Ahmad
caption: mos3abof.com
description: Using my Power Grid Load Status's api, I collected data for the past 7 days and a half about the load status every 10 minutes.When I plotted it using D3js, the output was scary!Each row represents a day, and every block stands for an hour of the day starting at 1…

data.message: أفتكر الأنسب إنك تخلي المربعات الجمراء "سودا"

عارف 

انت محتاج تخلي الراوتر يبقي مشترك في خدمه
Dyndns

وانت تعمل يوفتور
يعمل بنج وتعرف اني راوتر واقع عشان الكهرباء

تقدر تعرف كل منطقه الكهرباء قاطعه امتي
^ I saw Mosab  suggesting something like that some 8 month ago, right Mosab Ahmad?

I was saying that if I were working in TEData, I would use such data to plot power outages.

Yesterday, a friend suggested that he would use my API and configure a raspberry pi at his home to check a server he would setup online with heartbeats and plot outages accordingly. I like the idea, and might do it actually, specially that I have my rpi in the office already :)

What i was saying that people register the static ip address or dyndns sever name for dynamic ip address along with their location

And the server ping those ip address from time to time

Another idea is that you pick random ip address and convert them to location through any ip2location (google app engine support this)

I wrote this a few days ago,it might be helpful
https://github.com/kashwaa/loadmeter/blob/gh-pages/daystatus.js

the function getDayStatus returns today's history up to the moment at 15 minutes interval,
if used just before midnight it returns the entire day history
